sen.j: 貞信公記（ていしんこうき）は、関白太政大臣藤原忠平の日記。
sen.e: Teishinko-ki is the diary of FUJIWARA no Tadahira, who was Kanpaku Dajodaijin (imperial regent and grand minister).
Teishinko-ki is the diary of FUJIWARA no Tadahira, who was Kanpaku Dajodaijin (imperial regent and grand minister).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Teishinko-ki is the diary of Kanpaku Dajodaijin (imperial regent and grand minister) FUJIWARA no Tadahira.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 日記の名称は忠平の諡号「貞信公」に因んだもので、『貞信公御記』ともいう。
sen.e: The title of this diary is named after Tadahira's posthumous name "Teishinko" and the diary is also called "Teishinko Gyoki."
The diary's title is based on Tadahira's posthumous name "Teishinko," but the diary is also called "Teishinko Gyoki."
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: The diary's title derives from Tadahira's shigo (posthumous name) 'Teishinko,' but the is also called "Teishinko Gyoki."
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 10世紀前半の政治史を知るうえでの基本史料で、朝廷儀礼や政務に関する記述が多く見られる。
sen.e: It is a basic historical material for knowing about political history of the first half of Tenth Century, and there are many descriptions on courtesy in the Imperial Court and political affairs.

It's fundamental as a historical material for knowing about the political history of the first half of the tenth century, and there are many descriptions on courtesy in the Imperial Court and political affairs.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: It is a fundamental historical resource for understanding the political history of the first half of the 10th century and contains many descriptions relating to imperial court etiquette and government affairs.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 今日現存するのは、忠平28歳の延喜7年（907年）から、忠平薨去前年の天暦2年（948年）までの期間で、途中欠落している部分がある。
sen.e: Currently exiting portion is for the period from 907, when Tadahira was twenty-eight years old to 948, one year before his death, but there are missing parts.
The existing portion is for the period from 907, when Tadahira was 28 years old, to 948, a year before his death; however, there are missing parts.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: The surviving parts pertain to the period from the year 907 when Tadahira was aged 28 to the year 948, with sections missing within this period.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 忠平が記した日記の原形を伝える詳本は現存せず、現在伝来している『貞信公記』は、忠平の長男である藤原実頼が抄出した抄本である。
sen.e: No shohon [詳本 読み・定訳不明] which shows the original form of the diary written by Tadahira exists and "Teishinko-ki" which has been handed down is an abstract made by FUJIWARA no Saneyori, who was the first son of Tadahira.

No shohon [詳本 読み・定訳不明] that shows the original form of the diary written by Tadahira exists, and "Teishinko-ki," which has been handed down, is an abstract by FUJIWARA no Saneyori, the first son of Tadahira.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: The original detailed diary written by Tadahira no longer survives, and the extant "Teishinko-ki" is a transcription that was made by Tadahira's eldest son FUJIWARA no Saneyori.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 故に、記述が簡略であるため、他の日記に見られる朝儀の次第や、政務の手続き等の詳細な記述が余り見出せない。
sen.e: Therefore, as descriptions are simple, we cannot find many detailed descriptions on procedures for chogi (ceremony at Imperial Court) and political affairs which we usually see in other diaries.

Therefore, given the simplicity of the descriptions, one can't find many detailed descriptions on procedures for chogi (ceremony at the Imperial Court) and political affairs, as are usually found in such diaries.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: For this reason descriptions are shortened and there are few details of the procedures of imperial court ceremonies or government affairs as can be found in other diaries.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: また、「私記」という形で実頼の記した註記が附されている。
sen.e: Notes written by Saneyori is attached as "Shiki (private note)."
The notes written by Saneyori are attached as "Shiki (private note)."
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Annotations written as 'private notes' have also been added by Saneyori.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。原文に合せて' 'を補足しました。

sen.j: 他に特徴として、実頼が日記を抄出する際、多数の暦注記事も抜書きしていることから、原本は具注暦に書かれていたことが分かる。
sen.e: In addition, another feature is that many notes on calendar were excerpted when Saneyori made an abstract of the diary, and, therefore, we can know that the original was written on a guchureki (Japanese Lunisolar calendar).

Another feature is that many notes on the calendar were excerpted when Saneyori made an abstract of the diary, and, therefore we can assume that the original was written based on the guchureki (Japanese lunar-solar calendar).
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Another feature is that many of the dates with notes were excerpted from the calender when Saneyori transcribed the diary, so it is known the original work was written according to the guchureki (Japanese lunisolar calendar).
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。誤訳の為修正しました。

sen.j: ちなみに、藤原道長の日記である『御堂関白記』も具注暦に書かれている。
sen.e: By the way, FUJIWARA no Michinaga's diary, "Mido Kanpakuki, "is also written on guchureki.
Incidentally, FUJIWARA no Michinaga's diary, "Mido Kanpakuki," is also based on the on guchureki.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Michinaga's diary, "Mido Kanpaku-ki," was also written according to the guchureki.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。ハイフン補足しました。

sen.j: 現在、本書の写本は、九条元公爵家本（鎌倉時代初期、重要文化財）が天理図書館に、久松本が京都大学に所蔵されている。
sen.e: With respect to manuscripts of this boo, the Kujo motokoshakuke bon (manuscript of the house of Kujo (former prince))(beginning of the Kamakura Period; Important Cultural Property) is possessed by Tenri Central Library, and Hisamatsu bon (manuscript of Hisamatsu) is possessed by Kyoto University.

With respect to the manuscripts of this book, the Kujo motokoshakuke bon (manuscript of the house of Kujo (former prince)) (beginning of the Kamakura period; an Important Cultural Property) is held by the Tenri Central Library, and Hisamatsu bon (manuscript of Hisamatsu) is held by Kyoto University.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: The Kujo Moto Koshakuke Bon manuscript (early Kamakura period; Important Cultural Property) is held by the Tenri Central Library and the Hisamatsu Bon manuscript is held by Kyoto University.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: また、宮内庁書陵部、尊経閣文庫、神宮文庫等にも写本が所蔵されている。
sen.e: Archives and Mausoleum Department of the Imperial Household Agency, Sonkeikaku-bunko (a library of the Kaga Maeda family), the Jingu Library, etc. also possess manuscript.
The Archives and Mausoleum Department of the Imperial Household Agency, Sonkeikaku-bunko (a library of the Kaga Maeda family), the Jingu Library, etc., also possess manuscripts.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Manuscripts are also held by locations including the Imperial Household Archives, Sonkeikaku-bunko Library and the Jingu Library.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: また、『西宮記』『北山抄』などの儀式書に本書の逸文が見られる。
sen.e: Itsubun (a composition previously existed but doesn't exist now) of this book can be seen in gishikisho (book of ceremonies) such as "Saikyuki" (record of court practices and usage, written by MINAMOTO no Takaaki in Chinese style) and "Hokuzansho."

Itsubun (a composition that no longer exists) of this book can be seen in gishikisho (book of ceremonies) such as "Saikyuki" (a record of court practices and usage, written by MINAMOTO no Takaaki in Chinese style) and "Hokuzansho."
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Writings that were lost from this diary can be seen in other works including "Saikyuki" (record of court practices and usage, written by MINAMOTO no Takaaki in Chinese style) and "Hokuzansho" (a representative book of ceremonies for the Heian period written by FUJIWARA no Kinto).
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 刊本は、活字化されたものが『大日本古記録』『続々群書類従』に収められている。
sen.e: With respect to printed copies, typographic copies are included in "Dainihon Kokiroku" and ""Zoku Zoku Gunsho Ruiju"（classified collection of various books).
Regarding printed copies, typographic copies are included in "Dainihon Kokiroku" and ""Zoku Zoku Gunsho Ruiju"（a classified collection of various books).
sen.cmt: OK
sen.e: Printed copies of the diary are included within "Dainihon Kokiroku" and "Zokuzoku Gunsho Ruiju."
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: また、九条元公爵家本の影印本が、『天理図書館善本叢書』として刊行されている。
sen.e: Eiinbon (duplicates prepared by using photography) from Kujo motokoshakuke bon has been published as "Tenri Central Library unabridged book collection."
Eiinbon (photographic duplicates) from Kujo motokoshakuke bon have been published as the "Tenri Central Library unabridged book collection."
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: A printed copy of the Kujo Moto Koshakuke Bon manuscript is published as the "Tenri Toshokan Zenpon Sosho" (Tenri Central Library unabridged book collection).
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。
